The invisible made visible through technologies’
agency: a sociomaterial inquiry on emergency
remote teaching in higher education
Summary:
Paper about a student-teacher discussion from a graduate school in education during first lockdown months illustrating the power of technologies’ agencies. The discussion shows how participation in digitised classes gives rise to social inequality issues, power structures and ethical problems.
Key words: Breakdown; sociomateriality; higher education; Brazil;emergency remote teaching

Article name: Covid-19 controversies and critical research in digital education
Summary: Editorial that presents reflections about issues such as learning, media and technology related to education after the covid-19 pandemic. Points towards critical research on digital education.

Article name: Theorising on covid-19 educational emergency: magnifying glasses for the field of educational technology
Summary:
Paper that focuses on Covid-19 emergency-related changes in the field of educational technologies through an ethnographic case study based on Italian teacher online communities.
Key words: Covid-19 educational technology technology-enhanced, learning theorising design teacher professional development

Article name:
Experiences of teaching and learning in K-12
physical education during COVID-19: an
international comparative case study
Summary:
Paper illustrating the experiences of physical secondary education teachers during COVID-19 across different countries. Important themes that emerged and were common across countries were (in)flexibility of teaching practices, personal connection with students, social and emotional support and unearthing equity.
Key words: Physical education; COVID-19; teaching and learning; photovoice

Article name:
Students Attending School Remotely Suffer Socially,
Emotionally, and Academically
Summary:
Survey study reporting the decrease in social, emotional, and academic well-being through the impact of attending school remotely rather than in person.
Keywords: adolescence; adolescents; at-risk students; correlational analysis; COVID-19; effect size; factor analysis; lockdown; mental health; peer interaction/friendship; psychology; remote schooling; stress/coping; survey research

Article name: Leading Schools and Districts in Times of Crisis

Patterns in the Pandemic Decline of Public
School Enrollment
COVID-19 and the pre-existing language teacher supply crisis
Summary:
Paper introducing the profiles of language educators during the initial months of the pandemic. Dives in the ways in which their experiences influenced their human, social, structural and psychological capital and potentially their intentions to remain in the profession.
Keywords: COVID-19, language teacher attrition, pandemic, remote teaching, teacher shortage

Article name: A narrative inquiry of teacher educators’ professional agency, identity renegotiations, and emotional responses amid educational disruption
Summary:
Study diving into the responses of teacher educators to educational disruptions caused by COVID-19. Focuses on their enactment of professional agency and renegotiation of their identities and complex interplay of factors influencing these such as emotional well-being.
Keywords: Teacher educators, Professional agency, Identity renegotiation, Emotions, Disruption, Qatar

Article name:
Teaching during a Pandemic: United States Teachers' Self-Efficacy
During COVID-19
Summary:
Paper exploring how the new teaching approaches and requirements from the COVID-19 pandemic have impacted teachers' self-efficacy, specifically instructional and engagement efficacy. It also evaluates the effect that instruction type, level, accolades and location may have on instructional and engagement efficacy.
Keywords: Teacher efficacy, COVID-19

Article name:
Does psychological capital and social support impact engagement and
burnout in online distance learning students?
Summary:
Paper investigating the experience of postgraduate distance learning students within the Covid-19 pandemic. Evaluated the impact of psychological capital burnout on student engagement and considers social support as a moderator.
 Keywords: Psychological capital PsyCap Distance learning Online learning Burnout Engagement

Journal: International Journal of Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning
Article name: Forms of collaboration matters: CSCL across the contexts
Summary: In light of this recent pandemic and the shortcomings of remote learning, this paper discusses factors of successful computer collaborative learning and future research endeavours.

Article name: Fast and Slow Thinking to Address Persistent and Complex Problems in Teaching and Learning
Summary: Editorial that draws parallelisms between the dual-processing theory of slow and fast thinking to the impact of the pandemic in practice and research

Article name: Emergency Remote Language Teaching and U.S.-Based College-Level World Language Educators’ Intention to Adopt Online Teaching in Postpandemic Times
Summary:
Study exploring the impact of emergency remote language teaching (ERLT) on U.S.-based college-level world language educators’ intention to teach languages online in post pandemic times.
Keywords: emergency remote language teaching; world language educators; intention to adopt online teaching; mixed methods design

Journal: Journal of Research on Educational Effectiveness
Article name: Challenges with Evaluating Education Policy Using Panel Data during and after the COVID-19 Pandemic
Summary:
Commentary highlighting specific challenges for panel or longitudinal studies of K-12 education interventions during and following the COVID-19 pandemic.
Keywords: Difference-in-differences; comparative interrupted time series; policy evaluation; non-experimental study design

Journal: Journal of Research on Educational Effectiveness
Article name:
Sustaining a Sense of Success: The Protective
Role of Teacher Working Conditions during the
COVID-19 Pandemic
Summary:
Paper examining the experiences of teachers during the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic. Discusses teachers’ working conditions, student engagement influenced by inequalities and their effect on teachers’ sense of success.
Keywords: Teachers; working conditions; COVID-19; organizational change; equity

Journal: International Journal of Educational Technology in Higher Education
Article name: The disconnected: COVID-19 and disparities in access to quality broadband for higher education students
Summary:
In the contexts of many Higher Education Institutions to moving to mass online/blended learning, this study investigates differences in student access to digital learning resources while at home, including access to high-speed broadband services.
Key words: Online learning, Blended delivery, Broadband, Connectivity, COVID-19

Journal: International Journal of Educational Technology in Higher Education
Article name:
A bio‑environmental perspective on Emirati
female college students’ experiences in virtual
learning communities of inquiry
Summary:
Study exploring the perceptions of female Emirati college students concerning virtual learning environments following the sudden shift to online classes. Focuses on the cognitive, social, and teaching aspects influencing these students’ perceptions during this shift.
Keywords: Bio-ecology perspective, Cognitive skills, Community of Inquiry, Convergent parallel mixed methods, Interpretive phenomenology, Online classes, Postsecondary education, Virtual classrooms
